Call initializeYAYFarm() to allocate 10,000 tokens to YAYFarm contract\n * 2. Call initializeDAO() to allocate 10,000 tokens to DAO treasury\n * 3. Call setMerkleRoot() with airdrop merkle root\n * 4. Call transferAdminControl() to transfer ownership to timelock controller\n */\ncontract ERC20Token is ERC20, ERC20Burnable, AccessControl, ERC20Permit, ERC20Votes {\n    ERC721Burnable public immutable NFT_CONTRACT;\n    uint256 public constant REWARD_PER_BURN = 1 * 10 ** 18; // 1 token with 18 decimals\n    uint256 public constant TOTAL_SUPPLY = 40_000 * 10 ** 18;    // 40,000 tokens - fixed cap\n    uint256 public constant MAX_ALTAR_OFFERINGS = 8; // Maximum NFTs that can be placed on altar at once\n\n    // Maps user address to their token IDs on the altar\n    mapping(address => uint256[]) public altarOfferings;\n    // Maps token ID to the address that placed it on the altar\n    mapping(uint256 => address) public tokenIdToAltarAddress;\n\n    // Add new airdrop-related state variables\n    bytes32 public merkleRoot;\n    mapping(address => bool) public hasClaimedAirdrop;\n\n    // Events\n    event TokensPlacedOnAltar(address indexed user, uint256[] tokenIds);\n    event BurnRewardsClaimed(address indexed user, uint256 burnCount, uint256 rewardAmount);\n    event AirdropClaimed(address indexed account, uint256 amount);\n    event MerkleRootSet(bytes32 merkleRoot);\n    event Debug(string message, uint256 value1, uint256 value2);\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initializes the ERC20Token contract.\n     * @param _name The name of the token.\n     * @param _symbol The symbol of the token.\n     * @param defaultAdmin The default admin role holder.\n     * @param nftContract The address of the NFT contract.\n     */\n    constructor(\n        string memory _name,\n        string memory _symbol,\n        address defaultAdmin,\n        address nftContract\n    )\n        ERC20(_name, _symbol)\n        ERC20Permit(_name)\n    {\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, defaultAdmin);\n        NFT_CONTRACT = ERC721Burnable(nftContract);\n        _mint(address(this), TOTAL_SUPPLY);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the YAYFarm with its token allocation\n     * @param yayFarmAddress The address of the YAYFarm contract\n     */\n    function initializeYAYFarm(address yayFarmAddress) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        uint256 farmAllocation = 10_000 * 10 ** 18;\n        require(transfer(yayFarmAddress, farmAllocation), \"Transfer failed\");\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Initializes the DAO with its token allocation for protocol-owned liquidity\n     * @param daoAddress The address of the DAO treasury\n     */\n    function initializeDAO(address daoAddress) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        uint256 daoAllocation = 10_000 * 10 ** 18;\n        require(transfer(daoAddress, daoAllocation), \"Transfer failed\");\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Place NFTs on the altar for future burning\n     * @param tokenIds Array of token IDs to place on altar (max 8)\n     */\n    function placeOnAltar(uint256[] calldata tokenIds) external {\n        require(tokenIds.length <= MAX_ALTAR_OFFERINGS, \"Max 8 tokens\");\n        \n        for(uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            require(NFT_CONTRACT.ownerOf(tokenIds[i]) == msg.sender, \"Not owner\");\n            \n            // Handle existing altar registrations\n            address currentAltarOwner = tokenIdToAltarAddress[tokenIds[i]];\n            if(currentAltarOwner != address(0) && currentAltarOwner != msg.sender) {\n                removeTokenFromAltar(currentAltarOwner, tokenIds[i]);\n            }\n            \n            tokenIdToAltarAddress[tokenIds[i]] = msg.sender;\n        }\n        \n        altarOfferings[msg.sender] = tokenIds;\n        emit TokensPlacedOnAltar(msg.sender, tokenIds);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Claim YAY tokens for burned NFTs\n     */\n    function calculateBurnRewards() public view returns (uint256) {\n        uint256[] storage tokenIds = altarOfferings[msg.sender];\n        require(tokenIds.length > 0, \"No offerings found\");\n        \n        uint256 validBurns = 0;\n        \n        for(uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            try NFT_CONTRACT.ownerOf(tokenIds[i]) returns (address) {\n                // Token still exists, skip it\n                continue;\n            } catch {\n                // Token is burned\n                validBurns++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return validBurns * REWARD_PER_BURN;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Claim YAY tokens for burned NFTs\n     */\n    function claimYAYForBurnedNFTs() external {\n        uint256[] storage tokenIds = altarOfferings[msg.sender];\n        uint256 rewardAmount = calculateBurnRewards();\n        \n        // Clean up altar data\n        for(uint256 i = 0; i < tokenIds.length; i++) {\n            delete tokenIdToAltarAddress[tokenIds[i]];\n        }\n        delete altarOfferings[msg.sender];\n        \n        // Transfer rewards if any\n        if (rewardAmount > 0) {\n            require(transfer(msg.sender, rewardAmount), \"Transfer failed\");\n            emit BurnRewardsClaimed(msg.sender, rewardAmount / REWARD_PER_BURN, rewardAmount);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Remove a single token from an address's altar offerings\n     * @param owner Address that placed the token\n     * @param tokenId Token ID to remove\n     */\n    function removeTokenFromAltar(address owner, uint256 tokenId) internal {\n        uint256[] storage offerings = altarOfferings[owner];\n        for(uint256 i = 0; i < offerings.length; i++) {\n            if(offerings[i] == tokenId) {\n                offerings[i] = offerings[offerings.length - 1];\n                offerings.pop();\n                delete tokenIdToAltarAddress[tokenId];\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if(offerings.length == 0) {\n            delete altarOfferings[owner];\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Sets the merkle root for airdrop verification\n     * @param _merkleRoot The merkle root hash\n     */\n    function setMerkleRoot(bytes32 _merkleRoot) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        merkleRoot = _merkleRoot;\n        emit MerkleRootSet(_merkleRoot);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Claim airdrop tokens based on merkle proof\n     * @param amount Amount of tokens to claim\n     * @param merkleProof Array of hashes forming the merkle proof\n     */\n    function claimAirdrop(uint256 amount, bytes32[] calldata merkleProof) external {\n        require(!hasClaimedAirdrop[msg.sender], \"Already claimed airdrop\");\n        \n        // Verify the merkle proof - update to match the exact encoding used in the tree generation\n        bytes32 node = keccak256(abi.encode(msg.sender, amount));\n        require(MerkleProof.verify(merkleProof, merkleRoot, node), \"Invalid proof\");\n\n        // Mark as claimed and transfer tokens\n        hasClaimedAirdrop[msg.sender] = true;\n        require(transfer(msg.sender, amount), \"Transfer failed\");\n        \n        emit AirdropClaimed(msg.sender, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Transfers admin control to the timelock controller\n     * @dev Can only be called by the current admin\n     * @param timelock The address of the timelock controller\n     */\n    function transferAdminControl(address timelock) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        require(timelock != address(0), \"Cannot transfer admin role to zero address\");\n        \n        // Grant admin role to timelock\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, timelock);\n        \n        // Revoke admin role from current admin (msg.sender)\n        _revokeRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    // The following functions are overrides required by Solidity.\n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc ERC20\n     */ \n    /**\n     * @inheritdoc ERC20Votes\n     */ \n    /**\n     * @notice \n     * @param from The address which transferred the tokens.\n     * @param to The address which received the tokens.\n     * @param value The amount of tokens transferred.\n     */\n    function _update(address from, address to, uint256 value)\n        internal\n        override(ERC20, ERC20Votes)\n    {\n        super._update(from, to, value);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Retrieves the nonce for a particular owner.\n     * @param owner The address of the owner for which the nonce is retrieved.\n     * @return The nonce for the given owner.\n     */\n    function nonces(address owner)\n        public\n        view\n        override(ERC20Permit, Nonces)\n        returns (uint256)\n    {\n        return super.nonces(owner);\n    }\n}\n\n","keccak256":"0xcd284455039a1c7856e9002bb98843dd5e5f4e1d4d80171fb300b1f28572e720","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: ERC20Token is an ERC20 token with additional features such as burning, pausing, and minting, along with AccessControl and Permit functionalities.

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

CheckpointUnorderedInsertion().details: A value was attempted to be inserted on a past checkpoint.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256).details: The signature has an invalid length.

ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32).details: The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order.

ERC20ExceededSafeSupply(uint256,uint256).details: Total supply cap has been exceeded, introducing a risk of votes overflowing.

ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC5805FutureLookup(uint256,uint48).details: Lookup to future votes is not available.

InvalidAccountNonce(address,uint256).details: The nonce used for an `account` is not the expected current nonce.

SafeCastOverflowedUintDowncast(uint8,uin.details: Value doesn't fit in an uint of `bits` size.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

DelegateChanged(address,address,address).details: Emitted when an account changes their delegate.

DelegateVotesChanged(address,uint256,uin.details: Emitted when a token transfer or delegate change results in changes to a delegate's number of voting units.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

CLOCK_MODE().details: Machine-readable description of the clock as specified in ERC-6372.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys a `value` amount of tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys a `value` amount of tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `value`.

params.merkleProof: Array of hashes forming the merkle proof

clock().details: Clock used for flagging checkpoints. Can be overridden to implement timestamp based checkpoints (and voting), in which case {CLOCK_MODE} should be overridden as well to match.

params.nftContract: The address of the NFT contract.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

delegate(address).details: Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.

delegates(address).details: Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total supply of votes available at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes. Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a vote. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. Requirements: - `timepoint` must be in the past. If operating using block numbers, the block must be already mined.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getVotes(address).details: Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.daoAddress: The address of the DAO treasury

params.yayFarmAddress: The address of the YAYFarm contract

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.owner: The address of the owner for which the nonce is retrieved.

returns._0: The nonce for the given owner.

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

params.tokenIds: Array of token IDs to place on altar (max 8)

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferAdminControl(address).details: Can only be called by the current admin

params.timelock: The address of the timelock controller

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

devdoc.title: ERC20Token

calculateBurnRewards().notice: Claim YAY tokens for burned NFTs

claimAirdrop(uint256,bytes32[]).notice: Claim airdrop tokens based on merkle proof

claimYAYForBurnedNFTs().notice: Claim YAY tokens for burned NFTs

initializeDAO(address).notice: Initializes the DAO with its token allocation for protocol-owned liquidity

initializeYAYFarm(address).notice: Initializes the YAYFarm with its token allocation

nonces(address).notice: Retrieves the nonce for a particular owner.

placeOnAltar(uint256[]).notice: Place NFTs on the altar for future burning

userdoc.notice: Setup Process: 1. Call initializeYAYFarm() to allocate 10,000 tokens to YAYFarm contract 2. Call initializeDAO() to allocate 10,000 tokens to DAO treasury 3. Call setMerkleRoot() with airdrop merkle root 4. Call transferAdminControl() to transfer ownership to timelock controller
